required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Therapy for Chinese Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Gene Therapy for Chinese Hemophilia A With Adeno-associated Virus (AAV) Vector

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

clinical_study.source: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: GS001 is an open- label, non- randomized, uncontrolled study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and kinetics of a single intravenous infusion of GS001 in hemophilia A subjects with <1IU/dl residual FVIII levels.

detailed_description.textblock:
GS001 is a open- label, non- randomized, uncontrolled, study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and kinetics of GS001 in hemophilia A subjects with residual FVIII levels<1IU/dl. Three patients will be enrolled sequentially every 3 weeks or more between cohorts and administered with single infusion of GS001.Dose escalation may occur after a single patient has been safely dosed if the resulting FVIII activity at Week 3 is < 5 IU/dL.The dosing to the second subject will not be performed until acquiring the approve from independent safety committee.The dose levels are as follows:
1. 2×10^12 vg/kg
2. 6×10^12 vg/kg
2. 2×10^13 vg/kg Subjects will provide informed consent and then undergo screening assessments up to 4-8weeks prior administration of GS001. All subjects will undergo 52(+- 2) weeks safety observation.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment- related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of study treatment (Day 1) through up to the end of study (about 1 year)
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients experiencing treatment-related adverse events. Including inhibitor development.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the start of study treatment (Day 1) through up to the end of study (about 1 year)
From the start of study treatment (Day 1) through up to the end of study (about 1 year)

primary_outcome.measure: Neutralized antibody against AAV capsid protein
primary_outcome.time_frame: From screening period through up to 1 years
primary_outcome.description: Immune response against AAV capsid will be evaluated by measurement of the total antibody and neutralizing antibody against AAV capsid protein in plasma samples collected at multiple timepoints after dosing up to 1 year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vector- derived FVIII:C and FVIII antigen levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From pre-dose phase through up to 1 years post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Vector- derived FVIII:C and FVIII antigen levels will be measured after dosing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of infusion until the date of 3 consecutive documented negative results, assessed up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Serum and semen will be collected to assess clearance of vector genomes

secondary_outcome.measure: Annualized bleeding rate changes from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of elevation of FVIII level post-dose to the end of the study (about 1 year )
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized bleeding rate changes from baseline

intervention.description: Patients will be enrolled sequentially every 3 weeks or more between cohorts. Dose escalation may occur after a single patient has been safely dosed if the resulting FVIII activity at Week 3 is < 5 IU/dL.The dose levels are as follows: 2×10^12 vg/kg 6×10^12vg/kg 2×10^13 vg/kg

overall_official.affiliation: Chinese Academy of Medical Science and Blood Disease Hospital

facility.name: Chinese Academy of Medical Science and Blood Disease Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Institute of Hematology & Blood Diseases Hospital
